Computer programs can learn useful cognitive skills. This course will take a closer look at specific applications of machine learning algorithms.

With the help of their supervisors, students will read, understand, evaluate, and present selected research papers on machine learning methods in different application settings. At the end of the semester, each student will present their topic in a
15 min talk (+ 5 min discussion)
in English.
The 1st meeting (kick-off) will take place in person on
Friday, the 26th of April,  at 10 a.m. sharp, in MAR 4.033
. It will take roughly 45 minutes. After the 1st meeting, you will choose the topic which you will present at the end of the semester.
Presentations will be held in the format of a block seminar and will take place on
Thursday, the 27th of June 2024, from 9 - 18, (Presentation Block I) and,
Friday, the 28th of June 2024, from 9 - 18, (Presentation Block II)
in Room: MAR 4.033 (
Seminar Topics can be found here
This course is an elective in the B.Sc. module "Kognitive Algorithmen".
The presentations will take place in person
